description: USE AS A CAF� (USE WITHIN CLASS E OF THE USE CLASSES ORDER (2020)) TO INCLUDE THE INSTALLATION OF AN EXTERNAL KITCHEN DUCTING SYSTEM
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Block Plan; Cover Letter; Kitchen Extract Odour & Noise Control Details; 339/20/Plans as extg &proposed rev A; 339/20/ Proposed ducting details; Proposed rear view stimulated image; 339/20/Sectional elevations proposed

Condition : 3 - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - The use hereby permitted shall not be open to customers except between the hours of 08:00 to 23:00 on any day and no staff shall be present at the premises one hour after the closing time.

Condition : 5 - Noise levels (expressed as the equivalent continous sound level) LAeq (10 minutes), from the new plant/machinery associated with the new ductwork installation shall not exceed LA90-10dB at the boundary with any noise sensitive/residential property. The equipment shall be maintained as intended by the manufacturer's guidance.
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the area and the occupier of neighbouring properties and ensure compliance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2015 and policies DM D2, DM D3, DM EP2 and DM EP4 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014

Condition : 6 - Odour from the new extraction and odour control unit shall be designed and installed so that cooking odour is not detectable to affect other premises.
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the area and the occupiers of neighbouring properties and ensure compliance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2015 and policies DM D2, DM D3, DM EP2 and DM EP4 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014

Condition : 7 - No obstruction or cowl is to be fitted above the extract opening. Flexible couplings and mountings are to be used between the ductwork and the walls/ceiling so there is no transmittion of vibration to other premises.
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the area and the occupiers of neighbouring properties and ensure compliance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: Policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2015 and policies DM D2, DM D3, DM EP2 and DM EP4 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014

Condition : 8 - Drainage serving the kitchen in commercial part of the premises shall be fitted with an adequate grease separator.
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the area and the occupier of neighbouring properties and ensure compliance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2015 and policies DM D2, DM D3, DM EP2 and DM EP4 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014

Condition : 9 - Any hot food sales for consumption off the premises shall be strictly ancillary to the use of the premises as a caf� within class E of the Town and Country Planning Use Classes Amendment Order 2020 or any subsequent amending Order.
Reason:  To safeguard the amenities of surrounding area and to ensure compliance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, policy CS7 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policies DM.R4 and DM EP2 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 10 - The applicant is advised that the installation of the ducting to the rear of the property may require permission from the relevant landowners. Planning permission would not override any legal requirements in this respect.

Condition : 11 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:
 i) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
